Key Match Events: The Los Angeles Dodgers won the National League Division Series decider with a 2-0 shutout.
The San Diego Padres ended their season with a 24-inning scoreless streak, their longest such streak of the season.
Yu Darvish limited the damage to two solo homers in his almost fine innings pitched.
Shohei Ohtani finished the series 4-for-20 with 10 strikeouts, including three strikeouts in Friday's game.
Post-Match Reflections: Xander Bogaerts expressed regret and reflected on the absences of Ha-Seong Kim and Joe Musgrove.
Bogaerts mentioned the late Padres owner Peter Seidler and the special feeling of the season.
Manny Machado expressed pride in the team's effort and resilience.
Kyle Higashioka and Jackson Merrill shared their emotional connections and experiences with the team.
Yu Darvish and Jurickson Profar expressed disappointment and sadness over the loss.
Luis Arraez and Mike Shildt reflected on the team's good performance despite the outcome.
Jackson Merrill expressed his determination to improve and help the team in the future.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Padres led the majors in hits and batting average during the regular season.
The Padres finished the regular season with 93 wins, the second-most in franchise history.
The Padres had a six-run inning capped by a Fernando Tatis Jr. home run in their previous game.
Others: Joe Musgrove is expected to miss all of next season after having Tommy John surgery.
Ha-Seong Kim is expected to decline his end of a mutual option.
Jurickson Profar, Kyle Higashioka, David Peralta, Donovan Solano, and Tanner Scott are expected to join free agency.
